context_bundle.summary: Pulumi is an infrastructure as code tool that uses general-purpose programming languages to define and manage cloud infrastructure

onboarding.quick_start: pulumi new aws-typescript && pulumi config set aws:region us-west-2 && pulumi up
common_patterns: Project creation: 'pulumi new <template>' to scaffold new project with language and cloud
Stack configuration: 'pulumi config set aws:region us-west-2 --secret' for sensitive values
Resource definition: 'const bucket = new aws.s3.Bucket('my-bucket', { acl: 'private' })' in TypeScript
Stack outputs: 'export const bucketName = bucket.id' and 'pulumi stack output bucketName'
Component resources: 'export class MyComponent extends pulumi.ComponentResource' for reusable infrastructure
Automation API: 'pulumi.up({ stack, program })' for programmatic deployment
known_errors: Configuration not found: 'pulumi config --show-secrets' and verify stack is selected with 'pulumi stack select'
AWS credentials invalid: 'aws sts get-caller-identity' and verify AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
Resource creation failed: 'pulumi up --diff' and check resource dependencies and permissions
TypeError in code: 'pulumi preview' to validate code before deployment and check type definitions
State corruption: 'pulumi stack history' and 'pulumi stack --force' to recover from state issues
